a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Augmented Human Development Index: with vs. without income
The Augmented Human Development Index (AHDI) is a summary measure of historical achievement in four key
dimensions of human development: a long and healthy life, being knowledgeable, being free and having a decent standard
of living. This indicator is compared to a metric that excludes the standard of living dimension, measured by GDP per
Data source: Leandro Prados de la Escosura (2021)
